elements.title: Andaman and Nicobar Islands (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Barren Island (pictured), located in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, is the only active volcano in India?

elements.title: Tommy Wood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Irish International Brigader Tommy Wood had only been in Spain for 18 days when he was killed at the Battle of Lopera during the Spanish Civil War?

elements.title: Tupinizando (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Brazilian social media page Tupinizando is dedicated to the promotion of Old Tupi, a dead language?

elements.title: Xu Ruiyun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1940 Xu Ruiyun became the first Chinese woman to receive a PhD in mathematics?

elements.title: Greenpeace v. Eni (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Greenpeace v. Eni is the first climate change lawsuit filed against a privately owned company in Italy?

elements.title: Thambi Naidoo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that South African civil rights activist Thambi Naidoo was arrested along with Mahatma Gandhi and sent outside of Transvaal for refusing to register?

elements.title: Aisling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the novel series Aisling is based on a character archetype elaborated upon by users of a Facebook group?

elements.title: Rita Cox (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that storyteller Rita Cox thinks of stories as "gently echoed music" between the storyteller and the listener?

elements.title: an Arkansas TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an Arkansas TV station apologized for not being on the air by sending local media a drawing of ducks?
